channel.title: Any one happen to know what this is?
channel.description:
would anyone happen to know what this is? in my cmd box it always shows up at randoms times im not to sure if something someone does in the games does it but it does happen daily and today i thought i would go threw and see if it was fixible... but can't really find nothing to fix it lol.... any help or hints to this?
[code]java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -32 at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:22132) at client.packetProcess(client.java:18125) at client.process(client.java:18097) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:151) at server.main(server.java:52) kscape[fatal] - exception[/code] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ today was the first time this happned... maybe i messed something up as always =) [code]java.net.SocketException: Software caused connection abort: recv failed at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method) at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source) at client.packetProcess(client.java:18111) at client.process(client.java:18097) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:151) at server.main(server.java:52)[/code]
any help or just a good hint on how to fix this would be nice.

item.source: Any one happen to know what this is?

item.title: Any one happen to know what this is?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

java.net.SocketException: Software caused connection abort: recv failed
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
        at client.packetProcess(client.java:18111)
        at client.process(client.java:18097)
        at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:151)
        at server.main(server.java:52)

Well thats a normal error caused by who-knows-what. Thats a problem with the underlying socket.

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -32
        at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:22132)
        at client.packetProcess(client.java:18125)
        at client.process(client.java:18097)
        at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:151)
        at server.main(server.java:52)
kscape[fatal] - exception

And that is because a packet was mis-read by the server and the offset of the buffer thrown off. So, when it reads the next byte as a packet type and applies the decryption, it gets a negative value.
And with the line of code in the parseIncomingPackets method: packetSize = packetSizes[pktType];
With pktType being negative throws an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. :rolleyes:
Mopar servers these days… anyway:

This is unfixable unless you track down which packet is being mis-read. (Probably wrong packet size)
So just ignore them for now.

Read full topic
item.source: Any one happen to know what this is?
